title: SoC SAI 501-0-20 Introduction to Sound Production

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course covers the central concepts and vocabulary used by sound professionals working across a variety of audio-related professions. The class will be divided into three main sections: 1) acoustics and psychoacoustics, 2) analog audio technology, and 3) digital audio technology. In each section, learning will be reinforced by hands-on demonstrations in the studio and the classroom, and in projects to be completed both in and outside of class.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: This class is exclusively for students enrolled in the Sound Arts and Industries MA program.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? to lay the groundwork for a solid understanding of the central concepts of acoustics and audio production
? where possible, to connect these concepts to the cultural, historical, and scientific contexts where they originated, and where they are found today.
? to establish a familiarity with the dominant tools of audio production, in software and hardware, in the studio, in the editing suite, and in the field.
? to familiarize students with the operation and application of all available audio facilities and resources in the Department of Radio, Television, and Film, and beyond.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, several small projects, 3 mini-exams, and a final project.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: USB drive, deposit required for studio keys. Students may be asked to acquire materials for some class assignments, the total cost of which will not exceed $25 over the course of the quarter.
